headline.main: Sugar: Villain In Disguise?; Personal Health

docs.abstract: Article on sugar's reputed adverse health effects; illus (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: SUGAR PROPONENTS call it "quick energy," opponents say it's "empty calories." But to the average American, who consumes a third of a pound of it each day, sugar is mostly an irresis tibly good taste. Human societies have long equated sweetness with goodness--sweet mystery of life, sweet smell of success, sweetheart--and that enhances the attraction.
